{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, IT Operations",
  "description": "Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, IT Operations

Job Location:&nbsp;Katsina

About The Role


	The IT Manager role will ensure the provision of superior customer service throughout the business, through the maintenance, enhancement, and efficient operation of IT functions. Additionally, the role will include responsibility for ensuring the security and integrity of IT operations and systems, as well as the line management of IT officers and associates.
	The flexibility to work outside normal business hours is integral to this role, as is the ability to work under broad direction and minimal supervision.


What You Will Do


	Provide the first point of IT Support contact for all local ESPOIR staff, covering all hardware, software, and associated peripherals;
	Manage service requests and related service desk tickets, planning and prioritizing systematically to minimize backlog and ensure operational efficiency in ESPOIR&rsquo;s designated service desk system.
	Troubleshoot technical issues to resolution and/or escalate to colleagues, suppliers, or partner organizations as required.
	Monitor and manage the operational performance.
	Ensure that standard operating procedures and all relevant IT governance and processes are implemented and adhered to.
	Deploy computers, school technology, and associated peripherals including new installations and redeployment of existing equipment.
	Install and configure operating systems and software to agreed standards under the direction of the Director of IT and other senior IT personnel.
	Recommend, source, install, and maintain network equipment such as firewalls, routers, and switches
	Manage the local area network and internet connection and ensure network security through the installation of appropriate hardware and software, as well development of IT policies
	Manage IT infrastructure improvement projects, including scheduling and budgeting.
	Maintain existing equipment to standards, by performing upgrades, new installations, and carrying out routine procedures.
	Assist in the compilation and maintenance of an accurate inventory of hardware and software, and ensure that records are kept up-to-date within the service desk system.
	Expedite the repair of hardware faults and software configuration problems, notifying or forwarding to the relevant suppliers in a timely manner.
	Work with colleagues to monitor the performance of systems, ensuring that issues are appropriately escalated and resolved.
	Provide technical assistance to project teams and undertake technical project roles when required.
	Maintain and develop excellent working relationships with key suppliers, conducting dealings in a professional and appropriate manner.
	Provide at all times a professional, courteous, and rapid response to individual users.
	Supervise, train, and mentor junior staff members in all of the above.
	Demonstrate commitment to and promotion of a culture of service excellence and continual improvement within the IT Department.


What You Should Have


	A Degree from a recognized university with top marks in Computer Science or a related discipline.
	5-10 years of relevant IT/industry work experience.
	Experience working within a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent technical knowledge of PC hardware
	Working technical knowledge of current protocols, operating systems, and standards
	Software and hardware troubleshooting
	Windows desktop (7/8/X) and Windows Server (at least 2012) experience as well as Microsoft Office support and Active Directory administration; relevant Microsoft certification is a plus
	Routers, switches, and firewall experience
	Knowledge of Android technologies, smartphones, LAN and Wifi configurations.
	Experience with admin of Microsoft systems such as Navision, IIS, or Sharepoint.
	Experience with cloud services, in particular AWS.
	Experience working and training on a variety of IT subjects and applications
	Excellent writing and oral communication skills
	Good research skills, including the ability to identify and propose solutions to issues/crisis.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-02",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-03",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Interswitch"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Katsina",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193926"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Manager, IT Operations Job at Interswitch




        
    

        
        Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Manager, IT Operations

Job Location: Katsina

About The Role


	The IT Manager role will ensure the provision of superior customer service throughout the business, through the maintenance, enhancement, and efficient operation of IT functions. Additionally, the role will include responsibility for ensuring the security and integrity of IT operations and systems, as well as the line management of IT officers and associates.
	The flexibility to work outside normal business hours is integral to this role, as is the ability to work under broad direction and minimal supervision.


What You Will Do


	Provide the first point of IT Support contact for all local ESPOIR staff, covering all hardware, software, and associated peripherals;
	Manage service requests and related service desk tickets, planning and prioritizing systematically to minimize backlog and ensure operational efficiency in ESPOIR’s designated service desk system.
	Troubleshoot technical issues to resolution and/or escalate to colleagues, suppliers, or partner organizations as required.
	Monitor and manage the operational performance.
	Ensure that standard operating procedures and all relevant IT governance and processes are implemented and adhered to.
	Deploy computers, school technology, and associated peripherals including new installations and redeployment of existing equipment.
	Install and configure operating systems and software to agreed standards under the direction of the Director of IT and other senior IT personnel.
	Recommend, source, install, and maintain network equipment such as firewalls, routers, and switches
	Manage the local area network and internet connection and ensure network security through the installation of appropriate hardware and software, as well development of IT policies
	Manage IT infrastructure improvement projects, including scheduling and budgeting.
	Maintain existing equipment to standards, by performing upgrades, new installations, and carrying out routine procedures.
	Assist in the compilation and maintenance of an accurate inventory of hardware and software, and ensure that records are kept up-to-date within the service desk system.
	Expedite the repair of hardware faults and software configuration problems, notifying or forwarding to the relevant suppliers in a timely manner.
	Work with colleagues to monitor the performance of systems, ensuring that issues are appropriately escalated and resolved.
	Provide technical assistance to project teams and undertake technical project roles when required.
	Maintain and develop excellent working relationships with key suppliers, conducting dealings in a professional and appropriate manner.
	Provide at all times a professional, courteous, and rapid response to individual users.
	Supervise, train, and mentor junior staff members in all of the above.
	Demonstrate commitment to and promotion of a culture of service excellence and continual improvement within the IT Department.


What You Should Have


	A Degree from a recognized university with top marks in Computer Science or a related discipline.
	5-10 years of relevant IT/industry work experience.
	Experience working within a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent technical knowledge of PC hardware
	Working technical knowledge of current protocols, operating systems, and standards
	Software and hardware troubleshooting
	Windows desktop (7/8/X) and Windows Server (at least 2012) experience as well as Microsoft Office support and Active Directory administration; relevant Microsoft certification is a plus
	Routers, switches, and firewall experience
	Knowledge of Android technologies, smartphones, LAN and Wifi configurations.
	Experience with admin of Microsoft systems such as Navision, IIS, or Sharepoint.
	Experience with cloud services, in particular AWS.
	Experience working and training on a variety of IT subjects and applications
	Excellent writing and oral communication skills
	Good research skills, including the ability to identify and propose solutions to issues/crisis.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance Associate",
  "description": "Temploy NG is a unique talent and skill recruitment service. We simplify temporary employment for organisations and busy individuals by&nbsp;matching them with the right people for skilled and semi-skilled work &ndash; for periods as short as one day, one week, one month or one year.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Ido and environs, Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time, Hybrid

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented Finance Associate to manage accurate income and expense records, generate timely financial reports, and oversee account operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using approved accounting software,
	Reconcile monthly bank statements and manage ledgers and other financial transactions.
	Generate monthly income and expense reports, assist with budget preparation
	Ensure organized financial documentation for audit readiness and compliance.
	Track and document all operational expenses, utility bills, vendor invoices, and assist in coordinating payments based on approved memos and requisitions.


Qualifications/Requirements


	Degree or Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or a related field, with 1&ndash;2 years post-NYSC relevant accounting experience
	Strong background in bookkeeping, account reconciliation, and financial accounting
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office suites, Google Workspace, or accounting software.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectvely with vendors and executives.
	Detail-oriented and highly organized, capable of managing multiple priorities and tasks efficiently.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Note:&nbsp;Please apply only if you have the requirements and experience to deliver on the job.",

Finance Associate Job at Temploy Limited




        
    

        
        Temploy NG is a unique talent and skill recruitment service. We simplify temporary employment for organisations and busy individuals by matching them with the right people for skilled and semi-skilled work – for periods as short as one day, one week, one month or one year.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Associate

Job Location: Ido and environs, Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time, Hybrid

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented Finance Associate to manage accurate income and expense records, generate timely financial reports, and oversee account operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using approved accounting software,
	Reconcile monthly bank statements and manage ledgers and other financial transactions.
	Generate monthly income and expense reports, assist with budget preparation
	Ensure organized financial documentation for audit readiness and compliance.
	Track and document all operational expenses, utility bills, vendor invoices, and assist in coordinating payments based on approved memos and requisitions.


Qualifications/Requirements


	Degree or Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or a related field, with 1–2 years post-NYSC relevant accounting experience
	Strong background in bookkeeping, account reconciliation, and financial accounting
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office suites, Google Workspace, or accounting software.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectvely with vendors and executives.
	Detail-oriented and highly organized, capable of managing multiple priorities and tasks efficiently.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Note: Please apply only if you have the requirements and experience to deliver on the job.    

    

        Click here to Apply

	Using pre-approved scripts and CRM systems, you will engage leads, qualify prospects, and assist in closing potential deals in collaboration with the U.S.-based team.

	Convert qualified prospects into sales opportunities through consistent engagement and follow-up.
	Participate actively in training sessions to continuously improve performance and understanding of the U.S. real estate market.

	Maintain professionalism, integrity, and persistence in all interactions.

	Opportunity to work in aglobal real estate environmentwith a high-performance team.

Telemarketer (Closer) Job at ACE Recruiters Limited




        
    

        
        ACE Recruiters Limited - Our client, Niay Group is a dynamic Real Estate organization operating across theUnited States and Nigeria, with a core focus onreal estate bulk sales and distressed property markets.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telemarketer (Closer)

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time / Contract
Company: Niay Group
Industry: Real Estate (U.S. Distressed Property Market)

Position Overview
     

            
    




	We are expanding our sales operations and seekinghighly motivated, result-oriented Telemarketers (Closers)to join our growing team.
	This is a performance-driven role ideal for individuals who are confident communicators, persuasive, and eager to build a rewarding career in international real estate marketing.
	The Telemarketer (Closer) will be responsible for conductinghigh-volume outbound callsto prospective property owners, investors, and buyers within the U.S. real estate market.
	Using pre-approved scripts and CRM systems, you will engage leads, qualify prospects, and assist in closing potential deals in collaboration with the U.S.-based team.


Key Responsibilities


	Make 80–100 outbound calls dailyto potential property sellers, buyers, or investors.
	Engage and qualify leads using a structured sales script and CRM tool.
	Clearly communicate the benefits of real estate offers, addressing client inquiries professionally.
	Maintain accurate records of calls, leads, and conversions within the CRM system.
	Collaborate closely with the U.S. operations team to follow up on qualified leads.
	Convert qualified prospects into sales opportunities through consistent engagement and follow-up.
	Participate actively in training sessions to continuously improve performance and understanding of the U.S. real estate market.
	Meet or exceed weekly and monthly performance targets.
	Maintain professionalism, integrity, and persistence in all interactions.


Performance Expectation


	Each closer is expected to close at least one deal within the first four (4) weeks after training.
	Consistent underperformance may result in replacement through Ace Recruiters’ refill system.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degreein any discipline.
	Experience in telemarketing, sales, customer service, or real estate calling is highly desirable.
	Strong verbal communication skills and an excellent command of English with excellent diction.
	Proven ability to meet high call volume targets and close deals.
	Tech-savvy, with the ability to use CRMs, dialers, and VoIP systems effectively.
	Goal-driven, resilient, and comfortable handling objections.
	Ability to work remotely with minimal supervision while maintaining strong productivity.


What We Offer


	Base Salary: N300,000 monthly.
	Performance Bonus:?500,000 to ?1,000,000 per closed deal (depending on deal value).
	Tools & Support:Comprehensive training, sales scripts, CRM access, VoIP, and dialer setup.
	Long-term engagement withcareer growth opportunitiesas operations expand.
	Opportunity to work in aglobal real estate environmentwith a high-performance team.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphic Designer",
  "description": "Phase3 Telecom is West Africa&rsquo;s largest independent fibre optic infrastructure and telecommunications services provider. With coverage of 6000km and counting, the company is licensed to run its network on Nigeria&rsquo;s power infrastructure with expansion into the ECOWAS region using its unique Right of Way (RoW).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a skilled Graphic Designer to support Phase3 Telecom&rsquo;s corporate communications and branding efforts.
	This is an execution-focused role responsible for translating approved briefs into clear, professional visual materials across digital and print platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Design visual materials for digital platforms, presentations, reports, campaigns, and internal communications.
	Develop layouts, illustrations, and visual treatments in line with approved brand guidelines.
	Adapt designs for web, social media, print, and internal use.
	Maintain visual consistency across all design outputs.
	Ensure all designs align with Phase3 Telecom&rsquo;s brand identity, tone, and corporate standards.
	Review designs for accuracy, clarity, and production readiness.
	Execute tasks strictly based on approved briefs from the Head, Corporate Communications.
	Collaborate with communications officers, writers, and multimedia producers.
	Implement feedback accurately and within agreed timelines.
	Organise and maintain design files and assets.
	Prepare final files for digital publication or print production.
	Perform other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Multimedia, or a related discipline.
	Three to five years of relevant hands-on graphic design experience.
	A strong portfolio demonstrating both digital and print design work.


Required Skills:


	Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
	Solid understanding of layout, typography, colour theory, and visual hierarchy.
	Ability to convert written content into clear, engaging visual designs.
	Strong attention to detail and consistency.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;Recruitment@phase3telecom.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Graphic Designer Job at Phase3 Telecom




        
    

        
        Phase3 Telecom is West Africa’s largest independent fibre optic infrastructure and telecommunications services provider. With coverage of 6000km and counting, the company is licensed to run its network on Nigeria’s power infrastructure with expansion into the ECOWAS region using its unique Right of Way (RoW).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled Graphic Designer to support Phase3 Telecom’s corporate communications and branding efforts.
	This is an execution-focused role responsible for translating approved briefs into clear, professional visual materials across digital and print platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Design visual materials for digital platforms, presentations, reports, campaigns, and internal communications.
	Develop layouts, illustrations, and visual treatments in line with approved brand guidelines.
	Adapt designs for web, social media, print, and internal use.
	Maintain visual consistency across all design outputs.
	Ensure all designs align with Phase3 Telecom’s brand identity, tone, and corporate standards.
	Review designs for accuracy, clarity, and production readiness.
	Execute tasks strictly based on approved briefs from the Head, Corporate Communications.
	Collaborate with communications officers, writers, and multimedia producers.
	Implement feedback accurately and within agreed timelines.
	Organise and maintain design files and assets.
	Prepare final files for digital publication or print production.
	Perform other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Multimedia, or a related discipline.
	Three to five years of relevant hands-on graphic design experience.
	A strong portfolio demonstrating both digital and print design work.


Required Skills:


	Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
	Solid understanding of layout, typography, colour theory, and visual hierarchy.
	Ability to convert written content into clear, engaging visual designs.
	Strong attention to detail and consistency.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: Recruitment@phase3telecom.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media & Content Strategy Associate (Remote)",
  "description": "Citadel Center for HR Research &amp; Consulting (CCHRC) is building a credible voice in HR research, compensation insights, and labour-market analysis in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media &amp; Content Strategy Associate (Remote)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Description


	We are hiring a part-time Social Media &amp; Content Strategy Associate to create high-quality Canva content, plan weekly posts, and turn HR and workplace insights into clear, engaging social media content.
	The role is remote, flexible, and focused on building credibility and audience growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a weekly content plan
	Create clean Canva carousels, explainers, and insight posts
	Turn complex HR and workplace ideas into clear, engaging content
	Support campaigns tied to credibility and client interest
	Track performance (reach, saves, engagement, follower growth)
	Share a short weekly update: what worked, what didn&rsquo;t, what to improve


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	OND / HND or equivalent practical experience
	1+ year of managing social media for a brand or professional page
	Strong Canva design and content packaging skills
	Excellent writing and attention to detail
	Interest in HR, business, research, or workplace issues.


What Success Looks Like:


	Pages feel sharper, smarter, and more credible
	Audience growth is steady and targeted
	Content reflects depth, not generic HR posts
	Execution runs smoothly with minimal follow-up


Working Style:


	Fully remote (Flexible hours + scheduled check-ins)


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;people@cchrglobal.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-02",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-10",

Social Media & Content Strategy Associate (Remote) Job at Citadel Center for HR Research & Consulting (CCHRC)




        
    

        
        Citadel Center for HR Research & Consulting (CCHRC) is building a credible voice in HR research, compensation insights, and labour-market analysis in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media & Content Strategy Associate (Remote)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are hiring a part-time Social Media & Content Strategy Associate to create high-quality Canva content, plan weekly posts, and turn HR and workplace insights into clear, engaging social media content.
	The role is remote, flexible, and focused on building credibility and audience growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a weekly content plan
	Create clean Canva carousels, explainers, and insight posts
	Turn complex HR and workplace ideas into clear, engaging content
	Support campaigns tied to credibility and client interest
	Track performance (reach, saves, engagement, follower growth)
	Share a short weekly update: what worked, what didn’t, what to improve


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	OND / HND or equivalent practical experience
	1+ year of managing social media for a brand or professional page
	Strong Canva design and content packaging skills
	Excellent writing and attention to detail
	Interest in HR, business, research, or workplace issues.


What Success Looks Like:


	Pages feel sharper, smarter, and more credible
	Audience growth is steady and targeted
	Content reflects depth, not generic HR posts
	Execution runs smoothly with minimal follow-up


Working Style:


	Fully remote (Flexible hours + scheduled check-ins)


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: people@cchrglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply
